arez

Class ArezContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • arez.ArezContext

  • public final class ArezContext
extends Object
    The ArezContext defines the top level container of interconnected observables and observers. The context also provides the mechanism for creating transactions to read and write state within the system.

        Parameters:
        type - the component type.
        id - the component id.
        Returns:
        true if component is defined in context.

      • component

        @Nonnull
public Component component(@Nonnull
                                    String type,
                                    @Nonnull
                                    Object id)
        Create a component with the specified parameters and return it. This method should only be invoked if Arez.areNativeComponentsEnabled() returns true. This method should not be invoked if isComponentPresent(String, Object) returns true for the parameters. The caller should invoke Component.complete() on the returned component as soon as the component definition has completed.
        Parameters:
        type - the component type.
        id - the component id.
        Returns:
        true if component is defined in context.

      • component

        @Nonnull
public Component component(@Nonnull
                                    String type,
                                    @Nonnull
                                    Object id,
                                    @Nullable
                                    String name)
        Create a component with the specified parameters and return it. This method should only be invoked if Arez.areNativeComponentsEnabled() returns true. This method should not be invoked if isComponentPresent(String, Object) returns true for the parameters. The caller should invoke Component.complete() on the returned component as soon as the component definition has completed.
        Parameters:
        type - the component type.
        id - the component id.
        name - the name of the component. Should be null if Arez.areNamesEnabled() returns false.
        Returns:
        true if component is defined in context.

      • component

        @Nonnull
public Component component(@Nonnull
                                    String type,
                                    @Nonnull
                                    Object id,
                                    @Nullable
                                    String name,
                                    @Nullable
                                    SafeProcedure preDispose)
        Create a component with the specified parameters and return it. This method should only be invoked if Arez.areNativeComponentsEnabled() returns true. This method should not be invoked if isComponentPresent(String, Object) returns true for the parameters. The caller should invoke Component.complete() on the returned component as soon as the component definition has completed.
        Parameters:
        type - the component type.
        id - the component id.
        name - the name of the component. Should be null if Arez.areNamesEnabled() returns false.
        preDispose - the hook action called just before the Component is disposed. The hook method is called from within the dispose transaction.
        Returns:
        true if component is defined in context.

        @Nonnull
public Component component(@Nonnull
                                    String type,
                                    @Nonnull
                                    Object id,
                                    @Nullable
                                    String name,
                                    @Nullable
                                    SafeProcedure preDispose,
                                    @Nullable
                                    SafeProcedure postDispose)
        Create a component with the specified parameters and return it. This method should only be invoked if Arez.areNativeComponentsEnabled() returns true. This method should not be invoked if isComponentPresent(String, Object) returns true for the parameters. The caller should invoke Component.complete() on the returned component as soon as the component definition has completed.
        Parameters:
        type - the component type.
        id - the component id.
        name - the name of the component. Should be null if Arez.areNamesEnabled() returns false.
        preDispose - the hook action called just before the Component is disposed. The hook method is called from within the dispose transaction.
        postDispose - the hook action called just after the Component is disposed. The hook method is called from within the dispose transaction.
        Returns:
        true if component is defined in context.

      • computedValue

        @Nonnull
public <T> ComputedValue<T> computedValue(@Nullable
                                                   Component component,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   String name,
                                                   @Nonnull
                                                   SafeFunction<T> function)
        Create a ComputedValue with specified parameters.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the computed value.
        Parameters:
        component - the component that contains the ComputedValue if any. Must be null unless Arez.areNativeComponentsEnabled() returns true.
        name - the name of the ComputedValue. Should be non-null if Arez.areNamesEnabled() returns true, null otherwise.
        function - the function that computes the value.
        Returns:
        the ComputedValue instance.

      • computedValue

        @Nonnull
public <T> ComputedValue<T> computedValue(@Nullable
                                                   String name,
                                                   @Nonnull
                                                   SafeFunction<T> function,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onActivate,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onDeactivate,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onStale,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onDispose)
        Create a ComputedValue with specified parameters.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the computed value.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the ComputedValue.
        function - the function that computes the value.
        onActivate - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue changes from the INACTIVE state to any other state. This will be invoked when the transition occurs and will occur in the context of the transaction that made the change.
        onDeactivate - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue changes to the INACTIVE state to any other state. This will be invoked when the transition occurs and will occur in the context of the transaction that made the change.
        onStale - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue changes changes from the UP_TO_DATE state to STALE or POSSIBLY_STALE. This will be invoked when the transition occurs and will occur in the context of the transaction that made the change.
        onDispose - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue id disposed.
        Returns:
        the ComputedValue instance.

        onActivate - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue changes from the INACTIVE state to any other state. This will be invoked when the transition occurs and will occur in the context of the transaction that made the change.
        onDeactivate - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue changes to the INACTIVE state to any other state. This will be invoked when the transition occurs and will occur in the context of the transaction that made the change.
        onStale - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue changes changes from the UP_TO_DATE state to STALE or POSSIBLY_STALE. This will be invoked when the transition occurs and will occur in the context of the transaction that made the change.
        onDispose - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue id disposed.

      • computedValue

        @Nonnull
public <T> ComputedValue<T> computedValue(@Nullable
                                                   Component component,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   String name,
                                                   @Nonnull
                                                   SafeFunction<T> function,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onActivate,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onDeactivate,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onStale,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onDispose,
                                                   @Nonnull
                                                   Priority priority)
        Create a ComputedValue with specified parameters.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the computed value.
        Parameters:
        component - the component that contains the ComputedValue if any. Must be null unless Arez.areNativeComponentsEnabled() returns true.
        name - the name of the ComputedValue.
        function - the function that computes the value.
        onActivate - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue changes from the INACTIVE state to any other state. This will be invoked when the transition occurs and will occur in the context of the transaction that made the change.
        onDeactivate - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue changes to the INACTIVE state to any other state. This will be invoked when the transition occurs and will occur in the context of the transaction that made the change.
        onStale - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue changes changes from the UP_TO_DATE state to STALE or POSSIBLY_STALE. This will be invoked when the transition occurs and will occur in the context of the transaction that made the change.
        onDispose - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue id disposed.
        priority - the priority of the associated observer.
        Returns:
        the ComputedValue instance.

      • computedValue

        @Nonnull
public <T> ComputedValue<T> computedValue(@Nullable
                                                   Component component,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   String name,
                                                   @Nonnull
                                                   SafeFunction<T> function,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onActivate,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onDeactivate,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onStale,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onDispose,
                                                   @Nonnull
                                                   Priority priority,
                                                   boolean keepAlive,
                                                   boolean runImmediately)
        Create a ComputedValue with specified parameters.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the computed value.
        Parameters:
        component - the component that contains the ComputedValue if any. Must be null unless Arez.areNativeComponentsEnabled() returns true.
        name - the name of the ComputedValue.
        function - the function that computes the value.
        onActivate - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue changes from the INACTIVE state to any other state. This will be invoked when the transition occurs and will occur in the context of the transaction that made the change.
        onDeactivate - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue changes to the INACTIVE state to any other state. This will be invoked when the transition occurs and will occur in the context of the transaction that made the change.
        onStale - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue changes changes from the UP_TO_DATE state to STALE or POSSIBLY_STALE. This will be invoked when the transition occurs and will occur in the context of the transaction that made the change.
        onDispose - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue id disposed.
        priority - the priority of the associated observer.
        keepAlive - true if the ComputedValue should be activated when it is created and never deactivated. If this is true then the onActivate and onDeactivate parameters should be null.
        runImmediately - ignored unless keepAlive is true. true to compute the value immediately, false to schedule compute for next reaction cycle.
        Returns:
        the ComputedValue instance.

      • computedValue

        @Nonnull
public <T> ComputedValue<T> computedValue(@Nullable
                                                   Component component,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   String name,
                                                   @Nonnull
                                                   SafeFunction<T> function,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onActivate,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onDeactivate,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onStale,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Procedure onDispose,
                                                   @Nonnull
                                                   Priority priority,
                                                   boolean keepAlive,
                                                   boolean runImmediately,
                                                   boolean observeLowerPriorityDependencies)
        Create a ComputedValue with specified parameters.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the computed value.
        Parameters:
        component - the component that contains the ComputedValue if any. Must be null unless Arez.areNativeComponentsEnabled() returns true.
        name - the name of the ComputedValue.
        function - the function that computes the value.
        onActivate - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue changes from the INACTIVE state to any other state. This will be invoked when the transition occurs and will occur in the context of the transaction that made the change.
        onDeactivate - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue changes to the INACTIVE state to any other state. This will be invoked when the transition occurs and will occur in the context of the transaction that made the change.
        onStale - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue changes changes from the UP_TO_DATE state to STALE or POSSIBLY_STALE. This will be invoked when the transition occurs and will occur in the context of the transaction that made the change.
        onDispose - the procedure to invoke when the ComputedValue id disposed.
        priority - the priority of the associated observer.
        keepAlive - true if the ComputedValue should be activated when it is created and never deactivated. If this is true then the onActivate and onDeactivate parameters should be null.
        runImmediately - ignored unless keepAlive is true. true to compute the value immediately, false to schedule compute for next reaction cycle.
        observeLowerPriorityDependencies - true if the computed can observe lower priority dependencies.
        Returns:
        the ComputedValue instance.

      • autorun

        @Nonnull
public Observer autorun(@Nullable
                                 String name,
                                 boolean mutation,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 Procedure executable,
                                 boolean runImmediately)
        Create an autorun observer.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the observer.
        mutation - true if the executable may modify state, false otherwise.
        executable - the executable defining the observer.
        runImmediately - true to invoke executable immediately, false to schedule for next reaction cycle.
        Returns:
        the new Observer.

      • autorun

        @Nonnull
public Observer autorun(@Nullable
                                 String name,
                                 boolean mutation,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 Procedure executable,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 Priority priority,
                                 boolean runImmediately)
        Create an autorun observer.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the observer.
        mutation - true if the executable may modify state, false otherwise.
        executable - the executable defining the observer.
        priority - the priority of the observer.
        runImmediately - true to invoke executable immediately, false to schedule for next reaction cycle.
        Returns:
        the new Observer.

      • autorun

      • tracker

        @Nonnull
public Observer tracker(@Nonnull
                                 Procedure executable)
        Create a "tracker" observer that tracks code using a read-only transaction. The "tracker" observer triggers the specified executable any time any of the observers dependencies are updated. To track dependencies, this returned observer must be passed as the tracker to an track method like track(Observer, Function, Object...).
        Parameters:
        executable - the executable invoked as the reaction.
        Returns:
        the new Observer.

      • isTransactionActive

        Returns:
        true if there is a transaction in progress.

      • isTrackingTransactionActive

        public boolean isTrackingTransactionActive()
        Return true if there is a tracking transaction in progress. A tracking transaction is one created by an Observer via the autorun(Procedure) or tracker(Procedure) methods.
        Returns:
        true if there is a tracking transaction in progress.

      • isWriteTransactionActive

        Returns:
        true if there is a read-write transaction in progress.

      • isSchedulerPaused

        public boolean isSchedulerPaused()
        Return true if the scheduler is paused. True means that pauseScheduler() has been called one or more times and the lock not disposed.
        Returns:
        true if the scheduler is paused, false otherwise.

      • pauseScheduler

        @Nonnull
public Disposable pauseScheduler()
        Pause scheduler so that it will not run any reactions next time triggerScheduler() is invoked. The scheduler will not resume scheduling reactions until the lock returned from this method is disposed.

        The intention of this method is to allow the user to manually batch multiple actions, before disposing the lock and allowing reactions to flow through the system. A typical use-case is when a large network packet is received and processed over multiple ticks but you only want the application to react once.

        If this is invoked from within a reaction then the current behaviour will continue to process any pending reactions until there is none left. However this behaviour should not be relied upon as it may result in an abort in the future.

        It should be noted that this is the one way where inconsistent state can creep into an Arez application. If an external action can trigger while the scheduler is paused. i.e. In the browser when an event-handler calls back from UI when the reactions have not run. Thus the event handler could be based on stale data. If this can occur the developer should

        Returns:
        a lock on scheduler.

      • setEnvironment

        public void setEnvironment(@Nullable
                           ReactionEnvironment environment)
        Specify the environment in which reactions are invoked.
        Parameters:
        environment - the environment in which to execute reactions.

      • triggerScheduler

        public void triggerScheduler()
        Method invoked to trigger the scheduler to run any pending reactions. The scheduler will only be triggered if there is no transaction active. This method is typically used after one or more Observers have been created outside a transaction with the runImmediately flag set to false and the caller wants to force the observers to react. Otherwise the Observers will not be schedule until the next top-level transaction completes. Pending reactions are run in the environment specified by setEnvironment(ReactionEnvironment) if any has been specified.

      • scheduleDispose

        public void scheduleDispose(@Nonnull
                            Disposable disposable)
        Add the specified disposable to the list of pending disposables. The disposable must not already be in the list of pending observers. The disposable will be processed before the next top-level reaction.
        Parameters:
        disposable - the disposable.

        public <T> T action(@Nullable
                    String name,
                    boolean mutation,
                    boolean verifyActionRequired,
                    @Nonnull
                    Function<T> executable,
                    @Nonnull
                    Object... parameters)
             throws Throwable

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the transaction.
        mutation - true if the action may modify state, false otherwise.
        verifyActionRequired - true if the action will add invariant checks to ensure reads or writes occur within the scope of the action. If no reads or writes occur, the action need not be an action.
        executable - the executable.

        parameters - the parameters if any. The parameters are only used to generate a spy event.
        Throws:
        Throwable - if the procedure throws an an exception.

      • action

        public void action(@Nullable
                   String name,
                   boolean mutation,
                   boolean verifyActionRequired,
                   boolean requireNewTransaction,
                   @Nonnull
                   Procedure executable,
                   @Nonnull
                   Object... parameters)
            throws Throwable
        Execute the supplied executable in a transaction. The executable may throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the transaction.
        mutation - true if the action may modify state, false otherwise.
        verifyActionRequired - true if the action will add invariant checks to ensure reads or writes occur within the scope of the action. If no reads or writes occur, the action need not be an action.
        requireNewTransaction - true if a new transaction should be created, false if can use the current transaction.
        executable - the executable.
        parameters - the parameters if any. The parameters are only used to generate a spy event.
        Throws:
        Throwable - if the procedure throws an an exception.

      • track

        public void track(@Nonnull
                  Observer tracker,
                  @Nonnull
                  Procedure executable,
                  @Nonnull
                  Object... parameters)
           throws Throwable
        Execute the supplied executable with the specified Observer as the tracker. The Observer must be created by the tracker(String, boolean, Procedure) methods. The executable may throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        tracker - the tracking Observer.
        executable - the executable.
        parameters - the parameters if any. The parameters are only used to generate a spy event.
        Throws:
        Throwable - if the procedure throws an an exception.

      • noTxAction

        public void noTxAction(@Nonnull
                       Procedure executable)
                throws Throwable
        Execute the specified action outside of a transaction. The transaction is suspended for the duration of the action and the action must not attempt to create a nested transaction. The executable may throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        executable - the executable.
        Throws:
        Throwable - if the action throws an an exception.

      • noTxAction

        public <T> T noTxAction(@Nonnull
                        Function<T> executable)
                 throws Throwable
        Execute the specified action outside of a transaction. The transaction is suspended for the duration of the action and the action must not attempt to create a nested transaction. The executable may throw an exception.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of return value.
        Parameters:
        executable - the executable.
        Returns:
        the value returned from the executable.
        Throws:
        Throwable - if the action throws an an exception.

      • registerLocator

        @Nonnull
public Disposable registerLocator(@Nonnull
                                           Locator locator)
        Register an entity locator to use to resolve references. The Locator must not already be registered. This should not be invoked unless Arez.areReferencesEnabled() returns true.
        Parameters:
        locator - the Locator to register.
        Returns:
        the disposable to dispose to deregister locator.

      • locator

        @Nonnull
public Locator locator()
        Return the locator that can be used to resolve references. This should not be invoked unless Arez.areReferencesEnabled() returns true.
        Returns:
        the Locator.

      • addObserverErrorHandler

        public void addObserverErrorHandler(@Nonnull
                                    ObserverErrorHandler handler)
        Add error handler to the list of error handlers called. The handler should not already be in the list. This method should NOT be called if Arez.areObserverErrorHandlersEnabled() returns false.
        Parameters:
        handler - the error handler.

      • removeObserverErrorHandler

        public void removeObserverErrorHandler(@Nonnull
                                       ObserverErrorHandler handler)
        Remove error handler from list of existing error handlers. The handler should already be in the list. This method should NOT be called if Arez.areObserverErrorHandlersEnabled() returns false.
        Parameters:
        handler - the error handler.

      • getSpy

        @Nonnull
public Spy getSpy()
        Return the spy associated with context. This method should not be invoked unless Arez.areSpiesEnabled() returns true.
        Returns:
        the spy associated with context.
